ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The course has promise for students attempting to learn how to manage resources or what considerations that involves, but the problem is that assignments (not all, but about half) end up having you fiddle with spreadsheet toggles instead of actually thinking things through yourselves.
Course was able to provide both a very detailed and encompassing understanding of issues, factors, tools and thought processes to manage natural resources.
The availability of the instructor for help outside of class.
Chad's tidbits of information (don't build a road on this material! etc.)
very scholastically structured.
The practical lessons in resource management were invaluable
Prof. Oliver illustrated the key concepts in the course with compelling and engaging examples.
Professors real world examples.
1. Faculty's width of knowledge and industry experience2. A broad range of topics from the arena of managing resources3. Well constructed exercises although difficult at times !

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The clarity of the homework exercises and the purpose or applicability of them.
too much spreadsheet work. also, Chad doesn't always explain the assignments so for those of us without a forestry background, we don't automatically know the answers to his questions.
The instructor is very knowledgeable and extremely nice. But he needs to double check his assignment as there is much confusion.
Exercises were sometimes confusing--directions were unclear or inaccurate--and we wasted some time correcting them.
Having a TA would be helpful.
Having a TA to answer questions on qualitative exercises would help.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: very good

Confusions and problems were attended by the instructor instructor even in his chamber without any long waiting appointment protocol. The best thing in the dealings was that he always felt concerned about the issues and solved it by taking personal interest.
Prof Oliver was always available to explain the concepts when needed; his instructions were also always unequivocal
Excellent quality and readily available.
Excellent
No TA for the course

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course was interesting and helped me understand the complexity of managing resources.
It doesn't really.
Yes, it was very useful.
I was looking for a course that would teach me how to manage/utilize various resources ( natural and otherwise) sustainably while being mindful of conflicting requirements of multiple stakeholders.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I found it interesting and wanted to learn more about managing resources.
I have a lot of policy and wanted something more concrete to give me an idea of how things actually happen on the ground.
To enhance my knowledge
I was interested in finding out more about resource management.

I had heard that Prof. Oliver was an expert with enormous amounts of experience working both domestically and internationally on real, on-the-ground land management challenges. So, I wanted to see what he had to share about all this experience.
Same as above.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: yes
Somewhat - it could have been a lot more.
Yes
Yes, and more.

Yes, though it was different than I expected. While the assignments were challenging and the lectures were interesting, I didn't feel pushed very far beyond my comfort zone. It felt more like I was "practicing" skills, rather than learning brand new ones or pushing any boundaries of knowledge.

Yes. Some aspects were covered more superficially than the rest but the course was very helpful in introducing to me many different terminologies, tools, debates and facets surrounding environmental management

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: yes
Somewhat
Yes, I've learned valuable skills in management decision making and various aspects of resource management.
More then that
Yes, definitely.
I had few expectations. So all I can say is that I was definitely not disappointed. This course was very valuable!
yes,

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was very difficult as not everyone did a fair share of work all the time, yet they received a grade based on the work that I did.
No disadvantages. Advantages was having people to work on this with especially for long assignments.
People can share their work and learn from each other, however, sometimes there are free-riders.
It is a good experience
Advantages: division of labor, opportunities to learn from each otherDisadvantages: A learning curve was necessary when we initially worked together

I had two excellent teammates who were fun to work with and we were able to efficiently and fairly share the work. I also learned a lot from my teammates, who both have very different experiences than me. Was nice to get to know two new people and "practice" collaborating on a team.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take advantage of office hours.
Students should be more attentive to exercises
Go to office hours and get to know Prof. Oliver.
Course was able to provide both a very detailed and encompassing understanding of issues, factors, tools and thought processes to manage natural resources.
